content.1: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.
content.2: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
content.3: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.
content.4: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
content.5: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
content.6: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet,
content.7: The legs of the lame are not equal: so
content.8: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so
content.11: As a dog returneth to his vomit,
content.12: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit?

content.23: Burning lips and a wicked heart
content.24: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
content.25: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for
content.27: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
